FwXht_-PonAxoyM_DB740w.text: Parking around here was pretty scarce. Even the carpark at 112 Katong was full!!! Bergs has a Aircon portion and an outdoor part. Of course we opted for the indoor seats! Aircon was not strong so it helped that we dressed 'cooling'. I had the Berg with Cheese and I must say the overall taste was really good. I love their mayo, I think it's made fresh from scratch as I had not tasted mayo like this before. Hubby and I noticed that the beef patties are actually rather thin and dry, if not for the awesome sauce, I can imagine the burger being lacking in taste. Not sure if I would return as there are now many burger joints who would give Bergs a run for their money.

photos.caption: Photo of Bergs Gourmet Burgers - Singapore, Singapore. Calamari
Photo of Bergs Gourmet Burgers - Singapore, Singapore. Berg with Cheese

h-_OSBd88QNO-4w_rLYroA.text: Would not recommend. Burger meat is chewy and has an odd flavor. Also was covered in some funky steak sauce.  French fries were not bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Bergs Gourmet Burgers - Singapore, Singapore. Had to bail after a few bites.

fecX0gqGOSglY0GqSBkc0A.text: A super solid burger joint! Burgers are on the greasy side, so for the dieters out there, this spot is perfect for cheat day. I've only tried two burgers here so far, only because when I find something I like, I stick with it. The brekkie burger comes with a juicy patty topped with a fried egg, and is a good one to try if you're hungover and need some fuel to get you through the dreaded morning after. My go-to is the Berg with cheese. You get to choose from edam, swiss, or blue cheese. I wish they could offer cheddar, but usually swiss gets the job done!Add $5 and you could get a side and a drink. I did this the last time I visited and ended up not being able to finish my burger. A good outcome, I guess!

photos.caption: Photo of Bergs Gourmet Burgers - Singapore, Singapore. Side salad, $5
Photo of Bergs Gourmet Burgers - Singapore, Singapore. My cheeseburger. Add $5 and you can get a side and a drink.
Photo of Bergs Gourmet Burgers - Singapore, Singapore. Recently opened upstairs

X2hq--YBTaG4eJrtFeoBqw.text: Updating my review. I am officially hooked and torn between this place and Fat Boys Burgers. I think Bergs is slowly winning my heart. Not sure what it is. Maybe it's their special sauce (ew...you sickos...I am sure they don't do anything nasty) or how they grill/cook their burgers or toasted buns...something is quite addicting. Try The Berg when you are here and you will know what I mean. Why not 5-Stars?  After In-N-Out, how can you give 5 stars to any burger place???  Seriously!

-uns7q6ujBQOu1Z6idi5Hg.text: Well...I'd be lying if I didn't say the all day happy hour (5 beers for $35) didn't bring me in.  The burger was uninspiring, not very flavorful at all.  Lots of lettuce and onion and...that's about it.  Fries were good and my friend liked the chicken sandwich.  Don't think I'll be coming back anytime soon.

iGU11aEIxle5gQ-T4OnuNw.text: This place was a disappointment. I used to have bergs from the cbd branch and it was a favorite among my white colleagues too. The joint was quite empty and yet our food was served cold. The steak sandwich was drowned in sauce. The cheese wasn't even melted (that's how HOT the ciabatta was). I sent it back, and they brought me a well done steak when I had asked for medium rare at the time of ordering. I left after 2 bites. I'm never coming back here.

O--Xy6f-SM8APBXjMCh1Iw.text: The best burger I have had in Singapore! As an American living in Singapore I rarely eat western food in restaurants here for two reasons: the local fare is SO good and I am accustomed to being disappointed (I wouldn't expect a good pizza here anymore than I would expect to find good laksa in the Bronx).  But after a bit of shopping today decided to indulge a craving for some comfort food so stopped by Bergs.  I had the Berg and it was really, really tasty! The quality of the beef was great and the toppings were fresh. Service was really good as well.  I will absolutely go back.  In addition, it sits in one of the most fun places to visit in the east and it was nice to sit outside (even with the light rain) as they have a nice, covered outdoor area.

PB_fcbHx_FN5AjxYNYsr5g.text: Reminds me of the burgers in the USA, which I miss. We were on a hunt for tasty burgers and a few places were highly disappointing. Berg's burgers were tasty, juicy, beefy- wonderful! I had my husband give the chef a high 5.

Hozdu0FseVfdPtufxzm_Pw.text: All day breakfast burger was amazing with the aioli sauce. I don't really like the berg sauce (it's too sour). Bun is not dry or too thick. The berg w cheese was alright. Beef was really dry. If I was really hungry I'd head to McDonald's instead.

aKG58ZFt49WzImuu3me-3A.text: My husband and I have started coming here pretty much every week with our two kids, and all of us are vegetarian so burger places don't usually interest us. However, the falafel burgers are a big hit, as well as the tofu burgers. The atmosphere is very relaxed and cool, the service is great and the prices are reasonable. We love the fries and the Bergs sauce, as well as the good selection of beer on the menu. We live in the neighborhood and will continue to come back here often,

zBbdVvdreLwbRz-RokTxuw.text: Being from the USA this didn't remind me of any burger I had had while living in the states.  The ingredients were very odd to say the least and the burgers were cooked o.k. If you are looking for a good burger place that resembles what is cooked in the states, this place is not it.

Oo6y8X7KqdnNBV8ddTu-jQ.text: Very solid addition to the Eastcoast, Joo Chiat area. I like the quality chicken used for burgers as well as the fresh made burger patties. My wife loves the all day breakfast sandwich called the morning glory. Service can be great to a little slow when slammed! Overall 4stars!
